intro: Sodiroella ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian Sodiroella, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in spring. Sodiroella ecuadorensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
